Package it.polimi.ingsw.core

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.util.observers.ObservableObject
it.polimi.ingsw.util.observers.ObservableGame
it.polimi.ingsw.core.Game
public class Game
extends ObservableGame
This class is the main class for the model in the Distributed MVC pattern, this class is one of the few accessible classes of the core (the model) package, it expose some methods accessible from the outside classes which can be used to change the values of the game.

    This method applies the construction on the map performed by the player the information all present in the Build object.

    This method creates a loser and notifies it to all observers.

    This method close the game because a player has disconnected.

    This method creates a winner and notifies it to all observers.

    This method lock the worker for the active player.
    private void buildBuildings​(Build build)
    This method builds on the map from a given Build.
    private void changeActivePlayer()
    This method is called whenever there is a change of game phase where the active player should change, it changes the active player and notifies all observers.
    void changeTurn()
    This method handles the advancing of the turn, it means that it checks if it is needed only to advance the subphase (for god setup: challenger choice, gods choice and starter choice, for game turn: before move (which is also the start of the turn), move, before build, build, end turn) of the current phase or if is needed also to change the active player.
    void computeActions()
    This method computes only the moves and the builds which the player can perform in its turn.

  • Method Details

    • applyMove

      public void applyMove​(Move move) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      This method applies a move moving the workers on the map using the all information inside the Move object.
      Parameters:
      move - the object representing the move
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if move is null

    • applyBuild

      public void applyBuild​(Build build) throws java.lang.NullPointerException
      This method applies the construction on the map performed by the player the information all present in the Build object.
      Parameters:
      build - is the build to be performed
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if build is null

    • applyWin

      public void applyWin​(Player player) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method creates a winner and notifies it to all observers.
      Parameters:
      player - is the winner
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if player is not a player of the game

    • applyDefeat

      public void applyDefeat​(Player player) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method creates a loser and notifies it to all observers.
      Parameters:
      player - is the loser
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if player is not a player of the game

    • applyDisconnection

      public void applyDisconnection​(java.lang.String playerName) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method close the game because a player has disconnected.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the disconnected player
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if playerName is null

    • applyWorkerLock

      public void applyWorkerLock​(Player player, int worker) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      This method lock the worker for the active player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to lock the worker
      worker - worker to lock
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if player is null or isn't a player of the game or if worker isn't 2 or 3

    • changeTurn

      public void changeTurn()
      This method handles the advancing of the turn, it means that it checks if it is needed only to advance the subphase (for god setup: challenger choice, gods choice and starter choice, for game turn: before move (which is also the start of the turn), move, before build, build, end turn) of the current phase or if is needed also to change the active player.

    • changeActivePlayer

      private void changeActivePlayer()
      This method is called whenever there is a change of game phase where the active player should change, it changes the active player and notifies all observers.

    • removePlayer

      private void removePlayer​(Player player)
      This methods removes a player from the player list.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player to be removed

    • moveWorkers

      private void moveWorkers​(Move move, boolean conditioned)
      This method moves worker on the map from a given Move.
      Parameters:
      move - a Move saying where to move workers
      conditioned - says if the move is conditioned

    • buildBuildings

      private void buildBuildings​(Build build)
      This method builds on the map from a given Build.
      Parameters:
      build - a Build saying where to build

    • computeActions

      public void computeActions()
      This method computes only the moves and the builds which the player can perform in its turn.

    • computeMoves

      private void computeMoves​(Worker w, boolean move)
      Computes the workers moves.
      Parameters:
      w - the Worker which moves are computed
      move - a boolean which says if the phase is move of beforemove

    • computeBuilds

      private void computeBuilds​(Worker w)
      Computes the workers builds.
      Parameters:
      w - the Worker which builds are computed

      public Player getPlayerByName​(java.lang.String name) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Parameters:
      name - player's name
      Returns:
      a Player whose name is name
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player doesn't exist

    • getPlayerPossibleMovesWorker1

      public java.util.List<Move> getPlayerPossibleMovesWorker1()
      Gets a copy of the attribute playerPossibleMoves for the second worker.
      Returns:
      value of playerPossibleMoves where worker is 1

    • getPlayerPossibleMovesWorker2

      public java.util.List<Move> getPlayerPossibleMovesWorker2()
      Gets a copy of the attribute playerPossibleMoves for the first worker.
      Returns:
      value of playerPossibleMoves where worker is 2

    • setOrder

      public void setOrder​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> playerOrder) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      This method receives a list of player's names and set the order sorting the players arrayList.
      Parameters:
      playerOrder - is the ordered list of players turn sequence
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - it is thrown if playerOrder is null or if it doesn't represent a permutation of players arrayList
      WrongPhaseException - is thrown if this method is called on a different phase from the start

    • setPlayerColor

      public void setPlayerColor​(java.lang.String player, Color color) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      Sets the player's color indicated and updates the remote views about the colors actually chosen by the players sending an HashMap<String,Color> with player names and color chosen.
      Parameters:
      player - is the player which the color has to be set
      color - the color chosen by the player
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if color or player is null or if it is trying to set the color of a player which isn't the active player
      WrongPhaseException - if the phase isn't the color selection phase

    • setGameGods

      public void setGameGods​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> godNames) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      The methods sets the game gods passed in the list using the GodCardFactory class.
      Parameters:
      godNames - a list of the gods' names
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if godNames is null or its size is different from the number of players
      WrongPhaseException - if it isn't the gods phase

    • setPlayerGod

      public void setPlayerGod​(java.lang.String playerName, java.lang.String god) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      Sets the player's godCard.
      Parameters:
      playerName - player's name
      god - god's name
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if playerName or god are null or if god is not a game god or is already selected by another player
      WrongPhaseException - if it isn't the gods selection phase

    • setStarter

      public void setStarter​(java.lang.String starterName) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      It sets the starting player positioning it on the first position of the arrayList.
      Parameters:
      starterName - starter's name
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if starterName is null or the player doesn't exist
      WrongPhaseException - if it isn't the starter phase

    • setWorkerPositions

      public void setWorkerPositions​(NetGameSetup req) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, WrongPhaseException
      Sets the player's workers on the game map if the cells specified are free.
      Parameters:
      req - is the player's request
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - it req is null or the positions aren't valid
      WrongPhaseException - if it isn't the worker position phase

    • getPhase

      public Turn getPhase()
      Gets a copy of the current turn.
      Returns:
      copy of turn
